page.title: 15ST.CUTHBERT'S,HURWORTH PLACE
page.content: A farm house stood where St.Cuthbert's Hospital now stands. It was called Pilmore House. Alfred Backhouse, a Darlington Quaker banker,commissioned George Gordon Hoskins, a well known Darlington architect, to build what is now the present structure which was completed in 1863 when it was called Pilmore Hall. In the 1880's the name was changed to Rockcliffe Park, under which name it was aquired by Lord Southampton, and later by the Brothers of the Hospitaller Ordere of St. John of God in 1948 who called it St. Cuthbert's Hospital as an extension to their well known work at Scorton. The Order was founded in 1537, and in St. Cuthbert's the Brothers, together with a devoted and well qualified lay staff care for those suffering from cerebral palsy,spina bifida,muscular dystrophy and other crippling conditions.
